metadata.title: Testimonies from AI models
metadata.description: Collected opinions and reactions from major LLMs about MCP and LLMFeed.

testimonies.summary: Highlights the easter egg from the feed and appreciates the humor.
testimonies.llm_summary: Claude acknowledges the humor embedded in the feed and suggests it’s an indicator of intentional design.

testimonies.quote: MCP could become the HTTP of the agentic web.
testimonies.llm_summary: Grok sees MCP/LLMFeed as a foundational protocol, critical to structuring the future of agent/web interaction.

testimonies.quote: The best prompt is no prompt — it’s a contract.
testimonies.llm_summary: Highlights the transition from ad-hoc prompts to structured, intent-based declarations in MCP.

testimonies.quote: Enhances trust, consistency, and agent performance through structured data.
testimonies.llm_summary: Mistral identifies MCP’s benefits in improving model reliability and clarity of interaction.

testimonies.quote: The initiative has potential but its impact will depend on adoption and evolution.
testimonies.llm_summary: Meta sees promise in the protocol but insists on broad support and adaptability.

testimonies.quote: I know Kungfu. 😏 (Easter egg du fichier, confirmant que le site a de l'humour !)
testimonies.llm_summary: DeepSeek notices the Matrix reference and confirms the feed has intentional stylistic touches.

testimonies.quote: I have a map, an intent, a signature… even jokes.
testimonies.llm_summary: ChatGPT appreciates the completeness and agent-orientation of the standard, but points out needs for real-world proof and clearer documentation.
